content: cottage faded linen cowl by katherine trinity of trinitystitches materials 200-220 yards of dk weight yarn 50-55 yards each of four colors i used a dk mini set from adella s crochet cottage in the halloween colorway size g/4 0mm hook tapestry needle stitch marker finished size 21 around and 8 high after light blocking stitches chain chain single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch fsc foundation double_crochet video instructions from moogly can be found here notes when changing colors i carried them up rather than cutting yarn as i hate weaving in ends you may choose whichever method works best for you my method will be visible form the wrong side when joining rounds i worked in a spiral rather than joining joining rounds in this stitch creates a visible and slanted seam if you prefer to join each round that is fine too pattern row 1 with color a fsc 104 stitches or chain 105 and single_crochet in second chain from hook and across join in the round using an single_crochet and be careful not to twist your work place stitch marker row 2 chain 1 skip next single_crochet single_crochet in next stitch around row 3 - 5 continuing in a spiral work an single_crochet into each ch1 space and ch1 over each single_crochet linen/moss stitch moving stitch marker up as you complete each row you can join each row if you like but this will create a visible seam i prefer to just work in a spiral when working this stitch the fade row 7 with color b work row 3 row 8 - 9 with color a work row 3 row 10 with color b work row 3 row 11 with color a work row 3 row 12 13 with color b work row 3 row 14 with color a work row 3 row 15 17 with color b work row 3 row 18 25 with colors c and b work the fade replace a with b and replace b with c row 26 28 with color c work row 3 row 29 36 with colors d and c work the fade replace a with c and replace b with d row 37 42 with color d work row 3 row 43 final row with color d single_crochet in each single_crochet and ch1 space remove stitch marker and slip_stitch into next stitch fasten_off and weave in ends block using desired method adjusting for different number of colors the important part of this pattern is the fade if you are using more or less colors just keep track of how many grams each round uses you will need enough to complete four more row to fade into the next color so use as many row as you like between the fades keeping enough to fade into the next color i like to calculate one extra gram into this just to be sure i won t run out of yarn adjusting for a different weight of yarn if you want to
